CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of PERSON , GPE .

CARDINAL . As an employee of a ORG - owned company , in DATE the applicant and his family were granted a room in a shared flat . After his dismissal in DATE , the company sought his eviction . In DATE the company was reincorporated as a limited liability company .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought proceedings against the company asserting his right to live in the room . According to the Government , the applicant ’s claim was received by ORG on DATE . The respondent sought the applicant ’s eviction .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim and ordered his eviction . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment . The applicant obtained a stay of execution of the eviction order . On DATE the ORG of ORG quashed the above judgments by way of supervisory review and remitted the case for fresh examination .

CARDINAL . Thereafter ORG examined the case twice and rendered CARDINAL judgments . Each time ORG quashed the judgments and remitted the case for fresh examination . It appears that in the meantime the applicant resettled and the respondent company withdrew their claim for eviction .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the LAW entered into force in respect of GPE .

CARDINAL . In yet another round of the resumed proceedings , the applicant confined his claim to asking the court to require the respondent to provide him with housing . By a judgment of DATE , ORG granted this claim and ordered the company to provide the applicant with a flat . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment . The respondent sought supervisory review . On DATE the Presidium of ORG quashed the above judgments by way of supervisory review and remitted the case for re - examination .

CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , the applicant amended his claim and sought to substitute the respondent by the new company . On DATE ORG required the company to provide the applicant with housing . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment on appeal and remitted the case for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a new judgment in the applicant ’s favour . On DATE ORG set aside this judgment on appeal and ordered a new examination of the case . The district judge was on DATE leave from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . CARDINAL hearing was adjourned due to the applicant ; CARDINAL hearings were adjourned at the respondent ’s request . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment . The applicant sought supervisory review . On DATE the Presidium of ORG quashed the above judgments and remitted the case for fresh examination .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE a number of hearings were scheduled and adjourned mostly because the respondent failed to attend or sought adjournments . Several hearings were adjourned because of the applicant . CARDINAL hearing was adjourned in view of the judge ’s illness . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment .
